page.title: 19TRANSPORT
page.content: Until 1982 cars and lorries crossed the Firth by ferryboat from North Kessock.If there were more than 20 in the queue hurried drivers went 23 miles by Beauly.Now people only come for the bus.They go to the grocers or the Post Office and tourists eat at the N.Kessock Hotel.There is a boat centre and a hairdresser.It is a quiet highland village.This was a port for Black Isle grain and timber.Here the coal and mail came in.Now there are council houses and a village hall for dances,discos,badminton and the W.R.I. People keep beautiful gardens and compete in the annual flower show. The "Maid of the Ferry"is chosen at a summer dance and attends all local functions for a week.In the hotel bar are photographs of ferryboats,even sailing boats,from the last century.
